local_schema.longdesc: Used to store which type of archive was used the last time (0: zip, 1: tar.gz, 2: tar.bz2).
Used to store which plugin was used the last time files were sent using nautilus-sendto.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether or not keyboard locking is enabled
local_schema.longdesc: Whether or not keyboard locking is enabled.
Whether or not the typing break screen can be postponed.
Number of minutes that the typing break should last.
Number of minutes of typing time before break mode starts.
Set to true to disable all external thumbnailer programs, independent on whether they are independently disabled/enabled.
Maximum size of the thumbnail cache, in megabytes. Set to -1 to disable cleaning.
Maximum age for thumbnails in the cache, in days. Set to -1 to disable cleaning.
Whether to play sounds on input events.
The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.
Whether to play sounds on user events.
Enable sound server startup.
The default mixer tracks used by the multimedia key bindings.
The default mixer device used by the multimedia key bindings.
Size of the cursor referenced by cursor_theme.
Cursor theme name. Used only by Xservers that support Xcursor, such as XFree86 4.3 and later.

Font name of the cursor. If unset, the default font is used. This value is only propagated to the X server start of each session, so changing it mid-session won't have an effect until the next time you log in.
Highlights the current location of the pointer when the Control key is pressed and released.
Length of a double click.
Distance before a drag is started.
Distance in pixels the pointer must move before accelerated mouse motion is activated. A value of -1 is the system default.
Acceleration multiplier for mouse motion. A value of -1 is the system default.
Single click to open icons.
Swap left and right mouse buttons for left-handed mice.
When set to true, GNOME will remember the state of the NumLock LED between sessions.
File name of the bell sound to be played.
possible values are "on", "off", and "custom".

local_schema.short_desc: The list of enabled Keyboard Indicator plugins
local_schema.longdesc: The list of enabled Keyboard Indicator plugins
The background color for the layout indicator
The foreground color for the layout indicator
The font size for the layout indicator
The font family for the layout indicator
Show flags in the applet to indicate the current layout
Secondary groups
The Keyboard Preview, height
The Keyboard Preview, width
The Keyboard Preview, Y offset
The Keyboard Preview, X offset

local_schema.short_desc: Suppress the "X sysconfig changed" warning message
local_schema.longdesc: Suppress the "X sysconfig changed" warning message
Load exotic, rarely used layouts and options

local_schema.short_desc: Show layout names instead of group names
local_schema.longdesc: Show layout names instead of group names (only for versions of XFree supporting multiple layouts)

local_schema.short_desc: Save/restore indicators together with layout groups
local_schema.longdesc: Save/restore indicators together with layout groups

local_schema.short_desc: Keep and manage separate group per window
local_schema.longdesc: Keep and manage separate group per window

local_schema.short_desc: Default group, assigned on window creation
local_schema.longdesc: Default group, assigned on window creation
A list of modmap files available in the $HOME directory.
A collection of scripts to run whenever the keyboard state is reloaded. Useful for re-applying xmodmap based adjustments
Keyboard options
keyboard layout
keyboard model

local_schema.short_desc: Disable URL and MIME type handlers
local_schema.longdesc: Prevent running any URL or MIME type handler applications.
Prevent the user to lock his screen.
Prevent the user from switching to another account while his session is active.
Prevent the user from modifying print settings. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Print Setup" dialogs.
Prevent the user from printing. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Print" dialogs.
Prevent the user from saving files to disk. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Save as" dialogs.
Prevent the user from accessing the terminal or specifying a command line to be executed. For example, this would disable access to the panel's "Run Application" dialog.
Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to insert control characters.
Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to change the input method.
Keyboard shortcut to open the menu bars.
Module to use as the filesystem model for the GtkFileChooser widget. Possible values are "gio", "gnome-vfs" and "gtk+".
Whether to display a status bar meter on the right.
Whether to use a custom font in gtk+ applications.
Name of a monospaced (fixed-width) font for use in locations like terminals.
Name of the default font used for reading documents.
Name of the input method module used by GTK+.
Name of the GTK+ input method Status Style used by gtk+.
Name of the GTK+ input method Preedit Style used by gtk+.
Name of the default font used by gtk+.
Basename of the default theme used by gtk+.
Basename of the default theme used by gtk+.
Icon theme to use for the panel, nautilus etc.
Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milliseconds.
Whether the cursor should blink.
Size of icons in toolbars, either "small-toolbar" or "large-toolbar".
Whether the user can detach toolbars and move them around.
Whether the user can detach menubars and move them around.
Whether buttons may display an icon in addition to the button text.
Whether menus may display an icon next to a menu entry.
Toolbar Style. Valid values are "both", "both-horiz", "icons", and "text".
Whether the user can dynamically type a new accelerator when positioned over an active menuitem.
Whether menus should have a tearoff.
Whether animations should be displayed. Note: This is a global key, it changes the behaviour of the window manager, the panel etc.
Whether Applications should have accessibility support.
Theme used for displaying file icons.
How to shade the background color. Possible values are "horizontal-gradient", "vertical-gradient", and "solid".
Right or Bottom color when drawing gradients, not used for solid color.
Left or Top color when drawing gradients, or the solid color.
Opacity with which to draw the background picture.
File to use for the background image.
Determines how the image set by wallpaper_filename is rendered. Possible values are "none", "wallpaper", "centered", "scaled", "stretched", "zoom", "spanned".
Have GNOME draw the desktop background.
List of assistive technology applications to start when logging into the GNOME desktop.
Beep when a modifier is pressed.
Disable if two keys are pressed at the same time.
Do not accept a key as being pressed unless held for @delay milliseconds.
How many milliseconds to wait before mouse movement keys start to operate.

local_schema.short_desc: How long to accelerate in milliseconds
local_schema.longdesc: How many milliseconds it takes to go from 0 to maximum speed.
How many pixels per second to move at the maximum speed.
Ignore multiple presses of the _same_ key within @delay milliseconds.
A list with names of the first window manager workspaces. This key has been deprecated since GNOME 2.12.
The number of workspaces the window manager should use This key has been deprecated since GNOME 2.12.
Window manager to try first. This key has been deprecated since GNOME 2.12.
Fallback window manager if user window manager can't be found. This key has been deprecated since GNOME 2.12.
Whether the default tasks application needs a terminal to run
Default tasks application
Whether the default calendar application needs a terminal to run
Default calendar application
Whether the default browser understands netscape remote.
Whether the default browser needs a terminal to run.
Default browser for all URLs.

local_schema.short_desc: Start preferred Visual assistive technology application
local_schema.longdesc: GNOME to start preferred Visual assistive technology application during login.
Preferred Visual assistive technology application be used for login, menu, or command line.

local_schema.short_desc: Start preferred Mobility assistive technology application
local_schema.longdesc: GNOME to start preferred Mobility assistive technology application during login.
Preferred Mobility assistive technology application to be used for login, menu, or command line.
Argument used to execute programs in the terminal defined by the 'exec' key.
Terminal program to use when starting applications that require one.

local_schema.short_desc: Should Nautilus extension output debug statements
local_schema.longdesc: Should Nautilus extension output debug statements. The value should be set to true if it should.

local_schema.short_desc: Should brasero filter broken symbolic links
local_schema.longdesc: Should brasero filter broken symbolic links. Set to true, brasero will filter broken symbolic links.

local_schema.short_desc: Replace symbolic links by their targets
local_schema.longdesc: Should brasero replace symbolic links by their target files in the project. Set to true, brasero will replace symbolic links.
Should brasero filter hidden files. Set to true, brasero will filter hidden files.
Whether to display file preview. Set to true to use it.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to use the "--driver generic-mmc-raw" flag with cdrdao
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to use the "--driver generic-mmc-raw" flag with cdrdao. Set to True, brasero will use it; it may be a workaround for some drives/setups.

local_schema.short_desc: Used in conjunction with the "-immed" flag with cdrecord
local_schema.longdesc: Used in conjunction with the "-immed" flag with cdrecord.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to use the "-use-the-force-luke=dao" flag with growisofs
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to use the "-use-the-force-luke=dao" flag with growisofs. Set to false, brasero won't use it; it may be a workaround for some drives/setups.
Whether to use the "-immed" flag with cdrecord. Use with caution (set to true) as it's only a workaround for some drives/setups.

local_schema.short_desc: White list of additional plugins to use
local_schema.longdesc: Contains the list of additional plugins Brasero will use to burn discs. If set to NULL, Brasero will load them all.
Contains the name of the favourite burn engine suite installed. It will be used if possible.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to make font normal-size
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for making font the normal size. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to make font smaller
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for making font smaller. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to make font larger
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for making font larger. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

Keyboard shortcut key for launching help. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 12
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 12. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 11
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 11. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 10
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 10. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 9
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 9. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 8
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 8. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 7
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 7. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 6
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 6. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 5
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 5. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 4
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 4. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 3
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 3. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 2
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 2. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 1
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 1. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

Accelerator key to detach current tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Accelerator to move the current tab to the right.
local_schema.longdesc: Accelerator key to move the current tab to the right. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Accelerator to move the current tab to the left.
local_schema.longdesc: Accelerator key to move the current tab to the left. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the next tab
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to switch to the next tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the previous tab
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to switch to the previous tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to reset and clear the terminal
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to reset and clear the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to reset the terminal
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to reset the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to set the terminal title
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to set the terminal title. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to toggle the visibility of the menubar
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to toggle the visibility of the menubar. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to toggle full screen mode
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for toggling full screen mode. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

Keyboard shortcut key for pasting the contents of the clipboard into the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

Keyboard shortcut key for copying selected text to the clipboard. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to close a window
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for closing a window. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to close a tab
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for closing a tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to save the current tab contents to file
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key to save the current tab contents to a file. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to create a new profile
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for bringing up the dialog for profile creation. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to open a new window
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for opening a new window. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyboard shortcut to open a new tab
local_schema.longdesc: Keyboard shortcut key for opening a new tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to use the system font
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the terminal will use the desktop-global standard font if it's monospace (and the most similar font it can come up with otherwise).

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to use the colors from the theme for the terminal widget
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the theme color scheme used for text entry boxes will be used for the terminal, instead of colors provided by the user.

Sets what code the delete key generates. Possible values are "ascii-del" for the ASCII DEL character, "control-h" for Control-H (AKA the ASCII BS character), "escape-sequence" for the escape sequence typically bound to backspace or delete. "escape-sequence" is normally considered the correct setting for the Delete key.

Sets what code the backspace key generates. Possible values are "ascii-del" for the ASCII DEL character, "control-h" for Control-H (AKA the ASCII BS character), "escape-sequence" for the escape sequence typically bound to backspace or delete. "ascii-del" is normally considered the correct setting for the Backspace key.

local_schema.short_desc: How much to darken the background image
local_schema.longdesc: A value between 0.0 and 1.0 indicating how much to darken the background image. 0.0 means no darkness, 1.0 means fully dark. In the current implementation, there are only two levels of darkness possible, so the setting behaves as a boolean, where 0.0 disables the darkening effect.
If true, scroll the background image with the foreground text; if false, keep the image in a fixed position and scroll the text above it.
Filename of a background image.

Type of terminal background. May be "solid" for a solid color, "image" for an image, or "transparent" for either real transparency if a compositing window manager is running, or pseudo-transparency otherwise.
An Pango font name. Examples are "Sans 12" or "Monospace Bold 14".

Terminals have a 16-color palette that applications inside the terminal can use. This is that palette, in the form of a colon-separated list of color names. Color names should be in hex format e.g. "#FF00FF"
Icon to use for tabs/windows containing this profile.

local_schema.short_desc: Custom command to use instead of the shell
local_schema.longdesc: Run this command in place of the shell, if use_custom_command is true.
The possible values are "block" to use a block cursor, "ibeam" to use a vertical line cursor, or "underline" to use an underline cursor.
The possible values are "system" to use the global cursor blinking settings, or "on" or "off" to set the mode explicitly.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to run a custom command instead of the shell
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the value of the custom_command setting will be used in place of running a shell.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to update login records when launching terminal command
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the system login records utmp and wtmp will be updated when the command inside the terminal is launched.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to launch the command in the terminal as a login shell
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the command inside the terminal will be launched as a login shell. (argv[0] will have a hyphen in front of it.)

local_schema.short_desc: What to do with the terminal when the child command exits
local_schema.longdesc: Possible values are "close" to close the terminal, and "restart" to restart the command.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to scroll to the bottom when there's new output
local_schema.longdesc: If true, whenever there's new output the terminal will scroll to the bottom.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to scroll to the bottom when a key is pressed
local_schema.longdesc: If true, pressing a key jumps the scrollbar to the bottom.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether an unlimited number of lines should be kept in scrollback
local_schema.longdesc: If true, scrollback lines will never be discarded. The scrollback history is stored on disk temporarily, so this may cause the system to run out of disk space if there is a lot of output to the terminal.

local_schema.short_desc: Number of lines to keep in scrollback
local_schema.longdesc: Number of scrollback lines to keep around. You can scroll back in the terminal by this number of lines; lines that don't fit in the scrollback are discarded. If scrollback_unlimited is true, this value is ignored.
Where to put the terminal scrollbar. Possibilities are "left", "right", and "hidden".
Number of rows in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.
Number of columns in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to use custom terminal size for new windows
local_schema.longdesc: If true, newly created terminal windows will have custom size specified by default_size_columns and default_size_rows.

local_schema.short_desc: Characters that are considered "part of a word"
local_schema.longdesc: When selecting text by word, sequences of these characters are considered single words. Ranges can be given as "A-Z". Literal hyphen (not expressing a range) should be the first character given.
If true, don't make a noise when applications send the escape sequence for the terminal bell.
If true, allow applications in the terminal to make text boldface.
Title to display for the terminal window or tab. This title may be replaced by or combined with the title set by the application inside the terminal, depending on the title_mode setting.

local_schema.short_desc: What to do with dynamic title
local_schema.longdesc: If the application in the terminal sets the title (most typically people have their shell set up to do this), the dynamically-set title can erase the configured title, go before it, go after it, or replace it. The possible values are "replace", "before", "after", and "ignore".

local_schema.short_desc: Whether bold text should use the same color as normal text
local_schema.longdesc: If true, boldface text will be rendered using the same color as normal text.

local_schema.short_desc: Default color of bold text in the terminal
local_schema.longdesc: Default color of bold text in the terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if bold_color_same_as_fg is true.
Default color of terminal background, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

local_schema.short_desc: Default color of text in the terminal
local_schema.longdesc: Default color of text in the terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to show menubar in new windows/tabs
local_schema.longdesc: True if the menubar should be shown in new windows, for windows/tabs with this profile.
Human-readable name of the profile.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether to ask for confirmation when closing terminal windows
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to ask for confirmation when closing a terminal window which has more than one open tab.

A subset of possible encodings are presented in the Encoding submenu. This is a list of encodings to appear there. The special encoding name "current" means to display the encoding of the current locale.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the standard GTK shortcut for menubar access is enabled
local_schema.longdesc: Normally you can access the menubar with F10. This can also be customized via gtkrc (gtk-menu-bar-accel = "whatever"). This option allows the standard menubar accelerator to be disabled.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the menubar has access keys
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to have Alt+letter access keys for the menubar. They may interfere with some applications run inside the terminal so it's possible to turn them off.

local_schema.short_desc: Profile to use for new terminals
local_schema.longdesc: Profile to be used when opening a new window or tab. Must be in profile_list.
List of profiles known to gnome-terminal. The list contains strings naming subdirectories relative to /apps/gnome-terminal/profiles.

local_schema.short_desc: Keyring to which passwords will be saved
local_schema.longdesc: The name of the keyring gksu should use. Usual values are "session", which saves the password for the session, and "default", which saves the password with no timeout.
gksu can save the password you type to the gnome-keyring so you'll not be asked everytime

local_schema.short_desc: Display information message when no password is needed
local_schema.longdesc: This option determines whether a message dialog will be displayed informing the user that the program is being run without the need of a password being asked for some reason.
This option will make gksu prompt the user if he wants to have the screen grabbed before entering the password. Notice that this only has an effect if force-grab is disabled.
Whether sudo should be the default backend method. This method is otherwise accessed though the -S switch or by running 'gksudo' instead of 'gksu'.
Grab keyboard and mouse even if -g has been passed as argument on the command line.

Whether the keyboard and mouse grabbing should be turned off. This will make it possible for other X applications to listen to keyboard input events, thus making it not possible to shield from malicious applications which may be running.

This key specifies the name of the network configuration tool which should be invoked when the "Configure" button in the properties dialog is clicked. If the configuration tool can take a parameter of the interface to configure you may use %i in the string and it will be substituted with the interface name before invoking the configuration tool. For example, gnome-system-tool's network-admin tool takes the interface name through a --configure parameter. Thus, you could set the value of this key to be: "network-admin --configure %i".
The Network Interface monitored by the Network Monitor.

local_schema.short_desc: The initial y-coordinate for the window
local_schema.longdesc: The number of pixels to place the window from the top of the screen.

local_schema.short_desc: The initial x-coordinate for the window
local_schema.longdesc: The number of pixels to place the window from the left of the screen.
The size of the words used in bitwise operations. Valid values are 16, 32 and 64.
The initial trigonometric type. Valid values are "DEG" (degrees), "GRAD" (gradians) and "RAD" (radians).
Indicates whether the memory register window is initially displayed.
Indicates whether thousands separators are shown in large numbers.
Indicates whether any trailing zeroes after the numeric point should be shown in the display value.
The initial calculator mode. Valid values are "BASIC", "FINANCIAL", "LOGICAL", "SCIENTIFIC" and "PROGRAMMING"
The initial display mode. Valid values are "ENG" (engineering), "FIX" (fixed-point) and "SCI" (scientific)
The numeric base for input and display.
The number of digits displayed after the numeric point. This value must be in the range 0 to 9.
Whether Empathy has migrated butterfly logs.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy has asked about importing accounts
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy has asked about importing accounts from other programs.
Whether Empathy should automatically log into your accounts on startup.
Whether connectivity managers should be used to automatically disconnect/reconnect.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy should reduce the location's accuracy
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy should reduce the location's accuracy for privacy reasons.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy can use the GPS to guess the location
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy can use the GPS to guess the location.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy can use the cellular network to guess the location
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy can use the cellular network to guess the location.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy can use the network to guess the location
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy can use the network to guess the location.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy can publish the user's location
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy can publish the user's location to their contacts.
The default folder to save file transfers in.
MC 4 accounts have been imported.

local_schema.short_desc: Show hint about closing the main window
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show the message dialog about closing the main window with the 'x' button in the title bar.

local_schema.short_desc: Empathy should use the avatar of the contact as the chat window icon
local_schema.longdesc: Whether Empathy should use the avatar of the contact as the chat window icon.
Character to add after nickname when using nick completion (tab) in group chat.
Whether to check words typed against the languages you want to check with.
Comma-separated list of spell checker languages to use (e.g. "en, fr, nl").
Whether to use the theme for chat rooms.
Whether WebKit developer tools, such as the Web Inspector, should be enabled.

local_schema.short_desc: Path of the Adium theme to use
local_schema.longdesc: Path of the Adium theme to use if the theme used for chat is Adium.
The theme that is used to display the conversation in chat windows.
Whether to show the contact list in chat rooms.
Whether to convert smileys into graphical images in conversations.

local_schema.short_desc: Pop up notifications when a contact logs out
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show a popup notification when a contact goes offline.

local_schema.short_desc: Pop up notifications when a contact logs in
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show a popup notification when a contact goes online.

local_schema.short_desc: Pop up notifications if the chat isn't focused
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show a popup notification when receiving a new message even if the chat is already opened, but not focused.
Whether to show popup notifications when away or busy.

local_schema.short_desc: Enable popup notifications for new messages
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to show a popup notification when receiving a new message.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound when we log out
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound when logging out of a network.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound when we log in
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound when logging into a network.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound when a contact logs out
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound to notify of contacts logging out of the network.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound when a contact logs in
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound to notify of contacts logging into the network.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound for new conversations
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound to notify of new conversations.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound for outgoing messages
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound to notify of outgoing messages.

local_schema.short_desc: Play a sound for incoming messages
local_schema.longdesc: Whether to play a sound to notify of incoming messages.
Whether to play sound notifications when away or busy.
Whether to play a sound to notify of events.
Which criterion to use when sorting the contact list. Default is to sort by the contact's name with the value "name". A value of "state" will sort the contact list by state.

local_schema.short_desc: Open new chats in separate windows
local_schema.longdesc: Always open a separate chat window for new chats.

local_schema.short_desc: Default directory to select an avatar image from
local_schema.longdesc: The last directory that an avatar image was chosen from.
Hide the main window.
Whether to show the contact list in compact mode.
Whether to show protocols for contacts in the contact list.
Whether to show avatars for contacts in the contact list and chat windows.
Whether to show contacts that are offline in the contact list.
The default sound file used unless a notification supplies the 'sound-file' or 'suppress-sound' hint. Leave empty for no default sound.
Turns on and off sound support for notifications.
The theme used when displaying notifications.
Default popup location on the workspace for stack notifications. Allowed values: "top_left","top_right","bottom_left" and "bottom_right"

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the gnome-keyring SSH agent is enabled.
local_schema.longdesc: This option enables the SSH agent in the gnome-keyring daemon. It only takes effect as gnome-keyring-daemon starts, (ie: when the user logs in). This setting may be overridden when certain command line arguments are passed to the daemon.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the gnome-keyring PKCS#11 component is enabled.
local_schema.longdesc: This option enables the PKCS#11 component in the gnome-keyring daemon. It only takes effect during startup with gnome-session, (ie: when the user logs in). This setting may be overridden when certain command line arguments are passed to the daemon.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether the gnome-keyring secret service is enabled.
local_schema.longdesc: This option enables the secret service component in the gnome-keyring daemon. It only takes effect during startup with gnome-session, (ie: when the user logs in). This setting may be overridden when certain command line arguments are passed to the daemon.
